name: gimmicky
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
using something that is not serious or of real value to attract people's attention or interest temporarily, especially to make them buy something: gimmicky foods/fashions Modern-day productions of Shakespeare can too often seem gimmicky. See
gimmick
More examplesFewer examplesSome people say that reality television like this is a bit gimmicky.He is certain he has invented more than just a gimmicky fad. The producers decided that the stunt was too gimmicky.
